channel.title: Tiny java class
channel.description:
[code]ca fe ba be 00 00 00 00 00 03 01 00 01 42 07 00 01 00 00 00 02 00 02 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00[/code] At a whopping 31 bytes, javap takes it in fine.
Disassembled: [code]ca fe ba be[/code] The magic number.
[code]00 00 00 00[/code] The minor and major numbers.
[code]00 03[/code] The constant pool size (+1, due to the fact index 0 is the reserved entry).
[code]01 00 01 42[/code] CONSTANT_Utf8_info. Tag 1, string length 1, string "B".
[code]07 00 01[/code] CONSTANT_Class_info. Tag 7, name index 1.
[code]00 00[/code] Class access flags.
[code]00 02[/code] This class index.
[code]00 02[/code] Super class index.
[code]00 00[/code] Interfaces count.
[code]00 00[/code] Fields count.
[code]00 00[/code] Methods count.
[code]00 00[/code] Attributes count.
[code]class B extends B{ }[/code]
:p I think k00dr did something like this.

item.title: Tiny java class
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

ca fe ba be 00 00 00 00 00 03 01 00 00 07 00 01 00 00 00 02 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00

30-byte classfile!

[code]C:>javap A
class {
}

[/code]

Has an empty name, no superclass, access flags of 0, no fields, no implemented interfaces, no methods, no attributes, … just sex.

Read full topic

item.title: Tiny java class
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

oksuper_:

I thought you meant an index of 0 means it inherits from the Object class Misread, sorry.

Actually I meant that the default of 0 meant it inherits from Object. But I have been corrected.

Read full topic

item.title: Tiny java class

item.description:
@Jython wrote:

BAsh:

ANS: an index of 0 means the Object class.

item.title: Tiny java class
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

So if you somehow redefined object with no members…
class Object {
}
would that be the smallest possible class?

o nvm java/lang/Object

Read full topic

item.title: Tiny java class
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

For a class, the value of the super_class item either must be zero or must be a valid index into the constant_pool table. If the value of the super_class item is nonzero, the constant_pool entry at that index must be a CONSTANT_Class_info (§4.4.1) structure representing the direct superclass of the class defined by this class file. Neither the direct superclass nor any of its superclasses may be a final class.

If the value of the super_class item is zero, then this class file must represent the class Object, the only class or interface without a direct superclass.

so ye be correct

Read full topic

item.title: Tiny java class
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

c|p: that only deals with compilation… ‘extends clause’ gives it away. A super_class of 0 means no superclass (java.lang.Object has a super_class of 0).

Read full topic

item.title: Tiny java class
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

Only the class Object (§2.4.7) has no direct superclass. If the extends clause is omitted from a class declaration, then the superclass of the new class is Object.

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/jvms/second_edition/html/Concepts.doc.html#32983

Read full topic

item.title: Tiny java class
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

Wrong. How would Object inheriting from Object work then?

ANS: an index of 0 means the Object class.

item.title: Tiny java class
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

[quote=“BAsh, post:7, topic:294642”]you have to extend something so by extending itself you save a constant pool entry.

but it is invalid.[/quote]

Wrong. It is illegal. BTW, I was wondering how java.lang.Object worked without inheriting. I found out:

class B{ } 

ca fe ba be 00 00 00 00 00 03 01 00 01 42 07 00 01 00 00 00 02 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00

Read full topic

@Jython wrote:

ca fe ba be 00 00 00 00 00 03 01 00 01 42 07 00 01 00 00 00 02 00 02 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00

At a whopping 31 bytes, javap takes it in fine.

Disassembled:

ca fe ba be

The magic number.

00 00 00 00

The minor and major numbers.

00 03

The constant pool size (+1, due to the fact index 0 is the reserved entry).

01 00 01 42

CONSTANT_Utf8_info. Tag 1, string length 1, string “B”.

07 00 01

CONSTANT_Class_info. Tag 7, name index 1.

00 00

Class access flags.

00 02

This class index.

00 02

Super class index.

00 00

Interfaces count.

00 00

Fields count.

00 00

Methods count.

00 00

class B extends B{ }
